locations.name: Ocean
locations.description: The beach south of Pelican Town

locations.name: River
locations.description: Pelican Town and Cindersap Forest rivers

locations.name: Mountain Lake
locations.description: The lake north of the Carpenter's Shop

locations.name: Secret Woods
locations.description: Hidden area west of Cindersap Forest

locations.name: Sewers
locations.description: Unlocked with the Rusty Key from Gunther

locations.name: Desert
locations.description: The pond at the Calico Desert

locations.name: Ginger Island
locations.description: Various fishing spots on the island

fish.name: Pufferfish
fish.description: Inflates when threatened. Despite its cute appearance, this fish contains deadly toxins that make it dangerous to prepare incorrectly.
fish.locationDetail: Can be caught in the ocean during sunny summer days. It's fairly rare and requires precise timing.
fish.tips: This fish is notoriously difficult to catch due to its erratic movement. Consider using a Trap Bobber to make it easier. Only appears during a 4-hour window on sunny summer days.
fish.trivia: In real life, pufferfish (fugu) is a delicacy in Japan but requires special preparation to remove its deadly poison.

fish.name: Sturgeon
fish.description: An ancient bottom-feeder with a streamlined body. This prehistoric fish has remained largely unchanged for millions of years.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the mountain lake north of the Carpenter's Shop. Active throughout most of the day.
fish.tips: Sturgeons are excellent Fish Pond candidates. At high population, they produce Sturgeon Roe which becomes Caviar worth 500g in a Preserves Jar. This is one of the most profitable fish pond setups.
fish.trivia: Real sturgeon can live over 100 years and some species are critically endangered due to overfishing for caviar.

fish.name: Lava Eel
fish.description: It can somehow survive in pools of molten lava. Scientists are baffled by this fish's heat-resistant biology.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the lava pools on floor 100 of the mines and in the Volcano Caldera on Ginger Island.
fish.tips: One of the most difficult fish to catch in the game. Use a Cork Bobber for maximum fishing bar size. Consider catching this fish during a Lucky day and eating food that boosts fishing skill.
fish.trivia: The Lava Eel is one of the few fish that can be caught year-round in the same location.

fish.name: Legend
fish.description: The king of all fish! They say he's been alive for eons. This mythical creature represents the ultimate fishing achievement.
fish.locationDetail: Only appears in the mountain lake during rainy spring days. Requires Fishing Level 10 to encounter.
uses: Can be caught once per save file (vanilla)
fish.tips: This is the most difficult fish in the game. Maximize your fishing bar with Cork Bobber, eat Dish o' The Sea or Seafoam Pudding for +3-4 Fishing. Cast as far as possible for better odds of encounter.
fish.trivia: The Legend is one of five legendary fish in the base game. With the 1.5 update, extended family variants can be caught.

fish.name: Mutant Carp
fish.description: The strange waters of the sewers have turned this carp into a monster. Its glowing eyes hint at unnatural mutations.
fish.locationDetail: Found only in the Sewers. Requires the Rusty Key from Gunther (donate 60 items to the Museum).
fish.tips: While listed as difficulty 80, its darting behavior makes it unpredictable. The good news is it's available year-round and any time of day.
fish.trivia: The Sewers location is unlocked by donating 60 items to the Museum, and also contains Krobus's shop.

fish.name: Crimsonfish
fish.description: Lives deep in the ocean but likes to come up to the surface. Its brilliant red scales shimmer in the sunlight.
fish.locationDetail: Caught from the eastern pier at the beach during summer. Requires Fishing Level 5.
fish.tips: Cast from the eastern pier for the best chance. Unlike the Legend, weather doesn't matter. Bring Cork Bobber and fishing buff food.
fish.trivia: The Crimsonfish appears to be based on various deep-sea red fish species.

fish.name: Angler
fish.description: Uses a luminescent dangler to attract prey. This prehistoric-looking fish is a master of deep-sea hunting.
fish.locationDetail: Caught from the wooden plank bridge north of JojaMart during fall. Requires Fishing Level 3.
fish.tips: The Angler has smooth movement, making it one of the easier legendary fish. Fish from the wooden bridge north of JojaMart for the best results.
fish.trivia: Real anglerfish live in the deep ocean and use bioluminescence to attract prey in complete darkness.

fish.name: Glacierfish
fish.description: Builds its nest on the underside of glaciers. Adapted to survive in freezing temperatures that would kill most fish.
fish.locationDetail: Caught from the southern point of Cindersap Forest during winter. Requires Fishing Level 6.
fish.tips: Fish from the arrow-shaped point in south Cindersap Forest. This is the second-hardest legendary fish. Cork Bobber is almost mandatory.
fish.trivia: The Glacierfish is based on the concept of fish adapted to polar environments like Antarctic icefish.

fish.name: Catfish
fish.description: A whiskered bottom-feeder that feeds on small molluscs. Its barbels help it navigate murky river waters.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers and secret woods during rainy days across three seasons.
fish.tips: Wait for a rainy day in spring, summer, or fall. The river locations in town are excellent spots. This fish is needed for the River Fish Bundle.
fish.trivia: Catfish are named for their prominent barbels (whiskers) which resemble a cat's whiskers.

fish.name: Octopus
fish.description: A mysterious and intelligent creature. Known for its problem-solving abilities and escape artistry.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during summer mornings. One of the more challenging regular fish.
fish.tips: Despite being a non-legendary fish, the Octopus has difficulty 95—same as the Crimsonfish! Its sinker behavior requires quick reflexes. Best caught in the morning.
fish.trivia: Real octopuses are considered one of the most intelligent invertebrates, capable of opening jars and solving puzzles.

fish.name: Super Cucumber
fish.description: A rare, purple variety of sea cucumber. Its unusual coloration makes it highly sought after by collectors.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during evening hours in summer and fall.
fish.tips: Only appears in the evening/night. A good target for night fishing sessions during summer and fall.
fish.trivia: Despite its name, sea cucumbers are actually animals, not vegetables. They're echinoderms related to starfish.

fish.name: Salmon
fish.description: Swims upstream to spawn. This iconic fish makes one of nature's most challenging migrations.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers during fall. One of the more accessible fall fish.
fish.tips: A relatively easy fish that's common in fall. Great for building up fishing experience or completing bundles.
fish.trivia: Real salmon are anadromous, meaning they're born in freshwater, live in the ocean, and return to freshwater to spawn.

fish.name: Tuna
fish.description: A large, fast-swimming fish. Tuna are powerful swimmers capable of crossing entire oceans.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during summer and winter. Active most of the day.
fish.tips: Smooth behavior makes this fish predictable. Good for intermediate anglers looking to practice.
fish.trivia: Some tuna species like the bluefin can sell for millions of dollars at auction in real life.

fish.name: Largemouth Bass
fish.description: A popular sport fish known for the distinctive dark stripe along its sides. Prized by recreational anglers.
fish.locationDetail: Common in the mountain lake throughout most of the year.
fish.tips: One of the most accessible fish in the game. Great for beginners and available year-round.
fish.trivia: Bass fishing is one of the most popular recreational fishing activities in North America.

fish.name: Smallmouth Bass
fish.description: A freshwater fish known for putting up a good fight when hooked. Popular among sport fishermen.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers and the forest pond during spring and fall.
fish.tips: One of the easiest fish to catch. Perfect for new players building fishing skill.
fish.trivia: Smallmouth bass are known for their aggressive fighting style, making them exciting to catch on light tackle.

fish.name: Rainbow Trout
fish.description: A colorful freshwater fish with a distinctive pink stripe. Named for its beautiful iridescent coloring.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers and the mountain lake during summer. Only appears on sunny days.
fish.tips: Requires sunny weather, so plan your fishing trips accordingly. A good mid-tier catch.
fish.trivia: Rainbow trout are native to cold-water tributaries of the Pacific Ocean in North America and Asia.

fish.name: Tiger Trout
fish.description: A rare hybrid fish with striking patterns. The result of crossbreeding brown and brook trout.
fish.locationDetail: A rare catch in rivers during fall and winter.
fish.tips: The darting behavior can be tricky. Wait for it to slow down before adjusting your bar. More common than you might expect in rivers.
fish.trivia: Tiger trout are sterile hybrids, meaning they cannot reproduce. All tiger trout must be deliberately bred.

fish.name: Walleye
fish.description: A freshwater fish caught at night. Named for its large, reflective eyes that help it see in low light.
fish.locationDetail: Found in multiple freshwater locations during rainy fall nights.
fish.tips: Requires both rain AND fall season, plus afternoon/night time. Check weather reports and plan ahead.
fish.trivia: Walleye get their name from their unique eyes that appear to 'wall out' due to a reflective layer called the tapetum lucidum.

fish.name: Perch
fish.description: A spiny-rayed fish with a flaky white texture. A popular catch for casual anglers.
fish.locationDetail: Found in most freshwater locations during winter.
fish.tips: Good for winter fishing when options are limited. Dart behavior but low difficulty makes it manageable.
fish.trivia: Perch are one of the most widely distributed freshwater fish in North America and Europe.

fish.name: Pike
fish.description: A predatory freshwater fish with sharp teeth. An apex predator of the freshwater ecosystem.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers and forest pond during summer and winter.
fish.tips: Available year-round with a gap in spring and fall. Darting behavior requires quick reflexes.
fish.trivia: Pike are ambush predators that can strike at prey with incredible speed, earning them the nickname 'freshwater barracuda.'

fish.name: Sardine
fish.description: A small, oily fish that travels in schools. An important food source for larger ocean predators.
fish.locationDetail: Common ocean fish found in spring, fall, and winter.
fish.tips: Very easy to catch despite the darting behavior due to low difficulty. Great for beginners exploring ocean fishing.
fish.trivia: Sardines are named after Sardinia, Italy, where they were once abundant.

fish.name: Red Snapper
fish.description: A popular reef-dwelling fish. Known for its distinctive reddish-pink color and excellent eating quality.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during rainy summer and fall days.
fish.tips: Requires rainy weather. Check the weather channel and head to the beach when rain is forecast.
fish.trivia: Red snapper can live for over 50 years and are one of the most popular fish for recreational and commercial fishing in the Gulf of Mexico.

fish.name: Red Mullet
fish.description: A popular fish with a unique reddish color. Prized in Mediterranean cuisine.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during summer and winter.
fish.tips: Smooth behavior makes this predictable. Good practice for learning fish behavior patterns.
fish.trivia: Red mullet have been prized since ancient Roman times and were sometimes sold for extraordinary prices.

fish.name: Sea Cucumber
fish.description: A soft, squishy creature that lives on the ocean floor. Despite looking plant-like, it's actually an animal.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during fall and winter.
fish.tips: Sinker behavior means it tends to drop. Keep your fishing bar low. Easy to catch overall.
fish.trivia: Sea cucumbers can expel their internal organs as a defense mechanism and regenerate them later!

fish.name: Eel
fish.description: A slippery fish that's difficult to catch. Its snake-like body allows it to navigate tight spaces.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during rainy spring or fall days.
fish.tips: Look for rainy evenings in spring or fall. The smooth behavior makes it manageable despite the difficulty.
fish.trivia: Eels have a mysterious life cycle—all American and European eels spawn in the Sargasso Sea.

fish.name: Carp
fish.description: A common pond fish. Hardy and adaptable, carp have spread to waters around the world.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the mountain lake and other still waters year-round.
fish.tips: The easiest fish in the game! Perfect for absolute beginners or when you need a guaranteed catch.
fish.trivia: Carp are one of the most widely introduced fish species globally and can live over 40 years.

fish.name: Bullhead
fish.description: A common fish found in mountain lakes. Its wide, flat head gives it a distinctive appearance.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the mountain lake year-round.
fish.tips: Available year-round with smooth behavior. A reliable catch when you need lake fish.
fish.trivia: Bullheads are catfish relatives and have similar whisker-like barbels for sensing food.

fish.name: Bream
fish.description: A freshwater fish found in rivers. Popular with casual anglers for its abundance.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers year-round, especially active in evening hours.
fish.tips: Active in the evening. A good fish to target when starting night fishing.
fish.trivia: The term 'bream' is used for many different species of fish in different parts of the world.

fish.name: Sunfish
fish.description: A small, colorful fish found in rivers. Named for its bright, sun-like coloration.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers during spring and summer sunny days.
fish.tips: Only appears on sunny days. Very easy to catch—great for building early fishing experience.
fish.trivia: Sunfish are part of the same family as bass and can create elaborate circular nests in shallow water.

fish.name: Shad
fish.description: A river fish that runs upstream during certain seasons. Known for its annual spawning migrations.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers during spring, summer, and fall. Requires rain.
fish.tips: Requires rainy weather but available across three seasons. Good for rainy day fishing sessions.
fish.trivia: American shad were once so abundant they were a crucial food source for early colonists.

fish.name: Halibut
fish.description: A flat fish that lives on the ocean floor. One of the largest flatfish species.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during spring, summer, and winter.
fish.tips: Has split active times—morning and evening. Plan your beach trips accordingly.
fish.trivia: Halibut are born with eyes on both sides of their head, but one eye migrates as they mature!

fish.name: Lingcod
fish.description: A fearsome predator with a large mouth. Despite its name, it's not related to true cod.
fish.locationDetail: Found in rivers and mountain lake during winter.
fish.tips: One of the harder regular fish at difficulty 85. Good winter challenge for experienced anglers.
fish.trivia: Lingcod flesh can naturally turn blue or green due to a harmless pigment—it cooks to normal white color.

fish.name: Squid
fish.description: A deep sea creature that can grow to massive proportions. Famous for its intelligence and jet propulsion.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during winter evenings.
fish.tips: Only available at night during winter. The sinker behavior means keeping your bar low.
fish.trivia: Giant squid can grow over 40 feet long and have the largest eyes of any animal.

fish.name: Tilapia
fish.description: A warm water fish that's become popular worldwide. One of the most farmed fish globally.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during summer and fall.
fish.tips: Active in the morning hours. A reliable catch when beach fishing during summer and fall.
fish.trivia: Tilapia were one of the first fish species to be farmed, dating back to ancient Egyptian times.

fish.name: Dorado
fish.description: A golden freshwater fish prized by sport fishermen. Known for its spectacular fighting ability.
fish.locationDetail: A rare catch in the forest pond during summer.
fish.tips: One of the rarer fish in the forest pond. Difficulty 78 makes it a good challenge.
fish.trivia: The dorado (meaning 'golden' in Spanish) is famous for acrobatic leaps when hooked.

fish.name: Albacore
fish.description: A tuna-like fish caught in the ocean. One of the smaller tuna species but equally delicious.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during fall and winter.
fish.tips: Has morning and evening active times with a midday gap. Plan trips for early morning or after dinner.
fish.trivia: Albacore is the only tuna species that can legally be sold as 'white tuna' in the United States.

fish.name: Woodskip
fish.description: A forest fish with a distinctive mottled pattern. Perfectly camouflaged among underwater debris.
fish.locationDetail: Found only in the Secret Woods pond.
fish.tips: The Secret Woods requires a steel axe to access. Once unlocked, this fish is available year-round.
fish.trivia: The Woodskip is unique to the secret woods environment, making it a special catch for collectors.

fish.name: Ghostfish
fish.description: A translucent fish that lives in dark underground pools. Its pale coloration is an adaptation to cave life.
fish.locationDetail: Found in underground lakes on floors 20 and 60 of the mines.
fish.tips: One of the few fish found only in the mines. Bring your fishing rod when you go mining!
fish.trivia: Like real cave fish, the Ghostfish has adapted to darkness with its pale, translucent body.

fish.name: Stonefish
fish.description: A rare fish found deep in the mines. Disguised as a rock, it's nearly impossible to spot until hooked.
fish.locationDetail: Found on floor 20 of the mines.
fish.tips: Worth seeking out for its high base value. Sinker behavior—keep your bar low.
fish.trivia: Real stonefish are one of the most venomous fish in the world, camouflaging as rocks on the ocean floor.

fish.name: Ice Pip
fish.description: A rare fish found in the frozen depths of the mines. Its body has adapted to survive in near-freezing water.
fish.locationDetail: Found on floor 60 of the mines, in the frozen section.
fish.tips: High difficulty with darting behavior. One of the most valuable non-legendary fish. Use quality tackle.
fish.trivia: The Ice Pip inhabits the frozen level of the mines, surviving in conditions most fish couldn't tolerate.

fish.name: Scorpion Carp
fish.description: A dangerous looking fish found in the desert. Its venomous spines deter most predators.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the desert pond at the Calico Desert.
fish.tips: One of the hardest non-legendary fish due to difficulty 90 and darting behavior. Desert requires bus repair.
fish.trivia: The Scorpion Carp's dangerous appearance reflects real desert fish adaptations to harsh environments.

fish.name: Sandfish
fish.description: A fish that thrives in desert climates. Has adapted to survive in the harsh desert pond environment.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the desert pond at the Calico Desert.
fish.tips: More accessible than Scorpion Carp but still requires desert access. Good desert fishing practice.
fish.trivia: Real sandfish aren't actually fish—they're a type of skink lizard that 'swims' through sand!

fish.name: Midnight Carp
fish.description: A nocturnal carp that only surfaces at night. Its dark coloring helps it hide from predators.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the mountain lake and Ginger Island ponds at night.
fish.tips: Night fishing required. Fall/Winter only in the main valley, but year-round at night on Ginger Island.
fish.trivia: This carp has evolved specialized eyes for seeing in low-light conditions.

fish.name: Spook Fish
fish.description: A fish with large, reflective eyes adapted for deep water. Found only during the Night Market.
fish.locationDetail: Only available during the Winter Night Market submarine fishing (Winter 15-17).
fish.tips: Only catchable during the Night Market event (Winter 15-17). The submarine fishing has no tackle equipped.
fish.trivia: Based on the real barreleye fish, which has transparent head and tubular eyes.

fish.name: Blobfish
fish.description: A deep-sea fish known for its gelatinous appearance. Looks quite different at surface pressure.
fish.locationDetail: Only available during the Winter Night Market submarine fishing (Winter 15-17).
fish.tips: Hardest Night Market fish. Worth 500g base, making it valuable even at normal quality.
fish.trivia: Real blobfish only look blobby at surface pressure. In their deep-sea habitat, they look like normal fish!

fish.name: Midnight Squid
fish.description: A deep-water squid with bioluminescent properties. Only surfaces during the Night Market.
fish.locationDetail: Only available during the Winter Night Market submarine fishing (Winter 15-17).
fish.tips: Easiest Night Market fish. Good for filling out your fishing collection during the event.
fish.trivia: Some real deep-sea squid can produce light through bioluminescence to attract prey.

fish.name: Crab
fish.description: A popular crustacean with a hard shell. Moves sideways and has large pincers for defense.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: Requires Crab Pots, not fishing rod. Mariner profession removes junk. Luremaster makes bait unnecessary.
fish.trivia: Crabs are decapods with 10 legs, though we typically only see 8 as two are modified into claws.

fish.name: Lobster
fish.description: A large crustacean prized for its tender meat. Lives on the ocean floor.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: More valuable than crabs. Ocean Crab Pots can catch lobster, crab, shrimp, and others randomly.
fish.trivia: Lobsters can live over 100 years and continue growing throughout their lives.

fish.name: Shrimp
fish.description: A small, flavorful crustacean. Very popular in many cuisines around the world.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: Common ocean Crab Pot catch. Used in several cooking recipes.
fish.trivia: Shrimp hearts are located in their heads, not their chest.

fish.name: Crayfish
fish.description: A freshwater relative of the lobster. Also known as crawfish or crawdads.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in freshwater.
fish.tips: Freshwater Crab Pot catch. Place pots in rivers, ponds, or the mountain lake.
fish.trivia: Crayfish are considered an invasive species in many parts of the world.

fish.name: Snail
fish.description: A slow-moving gastropod with a spiral shell. Found in freshwater environments.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in freshwater.
fish.tips: Freshwater Crab Pot catch. Needed for Escargot recipe.
fish.trivia: Garden snails can sleep for up to three years if conditions are unfavorable.

fish.name: Periwinkle
fish.description: A small edible sea snail. Common in tidal zones around the world.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in freshwater.
fish.tips: Lowest value Crab Pot catch. Consider recycling for Quality Fertilizer with Recycling Machine.
fish.trivia: Despite the name, periwinkles in-game are found in freshwater, unlike real periwinkles.

fish.name: Mussel
fish.description: A bivalve mollusk that attaches to rocks. Filter feeder found in coastal waters.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: Ocean Crab Pot catch. Common but useful for Fish Stew recipe.
fish.trivia: Mussels can filter up to 65 liters of water per day, making them important for water quality.

fish.name: Oyster
fish.description: A prized bivalve known for producing pearls. Has a rough, irregular shell.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: Ocean Crab Pot catch. Medium value shellfish.
fish.trivia: Only certain oyster species produce pearls—the ones we eat typically don't.

fish.name: Cockle
fish.description: A small edible saltwater clam with distinctive ridged shell.
fish.locationDetail: Caught in Crab Pots placed in ocean water.
fish.tips: Ocean Crab Pot catch. Decent value among shellfish.
fish.trivia: Cockle shells are often found washed up on beaches and have been used as currency historically.

fish.name: Clam
fish.description: A bivalve found buried in beach sand. Must be dug up, not caught.
fish.locationDetail: Found as artifacts on the beach. Dig spots appear randomly.
fish.tips: Not caught with rod or Crab Pot—foraged from beach dig spots. Check beach daily for artifact spots.
fish.trivia: Some clam species can live for over 500 years, making them among the longest-lived animals.

fish.name: Coral
fish.description: A beautiful piece of coral. Not actually a fish but a colony of tiny animals.
fish.locationDetail: Found on the beach and Ginger Island. Summer spawns on beach, year-round on island.
fish.tips: Summer beach forage or year-round on Ginger Island. Used in Fish Tank bundle at Community Center.
fish.trivia: Real coral reefs support 25% of all marine species despite covering less than 1% of the ocean floor.

fish.name: Sea Urchin
fish.description: A spiny creature found in tidal pools. Actually a relative of starfish.
fish.locationDetail: Found on the beach and Ginger Island during summer, year-round on island.
fish.tips: Summer beach forage or year-round on Ginger Island. Relatively high value for a foraged item.
fish.trivia: Sea urchin roe (uni) is considered a delicacy in Japanese cuisine.

fish.name: Stingray
fish.description: A flat fish with a venomous tail spine. Gracefully glides through tropical waters.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean waters around Ginger Island and in the Pirate Cove.
fish.tips: Ginger Island exclusive fish. Fairly difficult with sinker behavior. Cast in the Pirate Cove area.
fish.trivia: Stingrays are closely related to sharks and have been around for 150 million years.

fish.name: Lionfish
fish.description: A venomous fish with distinctive striped fins. Native to coral reefs.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean waters around Ginger Island.
fish.tips: Ginger Island ocean fish. Relatively easy to catch due to smooth behavior.
fish.trivia: Lionfish are invasive in the Atlantic and have no natural predators there.

fish.name: Blue Discus
fish.description: A vibrant tropical fish known for its disc-shaped body and blue coloration.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the river on Ginger Island.
fish.tips: Found in the Ginger Island river (freshwater). Darting behavior makes it moderately tricky.
fish.trivia: Discus fish are called 'King of the Aquarium' due to their beauty and challenging care requirements.

fish.name: Son of Crimsonfish
fish.description: The offspring of the legendary Crimsonfish. A new legendary challenge added in 1.5.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean during summer after catching the original Crimsonfish. Requires Qi's Extended Family quest.
fish.tips: Part of Qi's Extended Family quest. Must catch original Crimsonfish first. Similar difficulty to parent.
fish.trivia: Added in the 1.5 update as part of the Legendary Fish II collection.

fish.name: Ms. Angler
fish.description: The mate of the legendary Angler. Part of the extended legendary fish family.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the river during fall after catching the original Angler. Requires Qi's Extended Family quest.
fish.tips: Part of Qi's Extended Family quest. Must catch original Angler first. Smooth behavior makes it manageable.
fish.trivia: Added in the 1.5 update. The name is a play on 'Miss Angler' being the Angler's mate.

fish.name: Legend II
fish.description: A descendant of the legendary Legend. The ultimate fishing challenge returns.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the mountain lake during rainy spring days after catching the original Legend. Requires Qi's Extended Family quest.
fish.tips: The hardest fish in the game. Same conditions as original Legend. Max out your gear and buffs.
fish.trivia: Despite the name, Legend II is not easier than the original—same difficulty 110.

fish.name: Glacierfish Jr.
fish.description: The young offspring of the Glacierfish. Found in the frozen waters of Cindersap Forest.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the river at Cindersap Forest in winter after catching original Glacierfish. Requires Qi's Extended Family quest.
fish.tips: Part of Qi's Extended Family quest. Winter only. Not quite as hard as Legend II but still challenging.
fish.trivia: Found in a different location than its parent (forest river vs. Cindersap tip).

fish.name: Radioactive Carp
fish.description: A glowing mutant carp from the radioactive mines. Even more mutated than its parent.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the sewers after catching the original Mutant Carp. Requires Qi's Extended Family quest.
fish.tips: Part of Qi's Extended Family quest. Same location as Mutant Carp (Sewers). Year-round availability.
fish.trivia: Its radioactive glow suggests even more mutation than its already-mutant parent.

fish.name: Goby
fish.description: A small bottom-dwelling fish. Common but not very valuable.
fish.locationDetail: Found in the ocean around Ginger Island. Very common catch.
fish.tips: The easiest and least valuable fish on Ginger Island. Good for fishing XP.
fish.trivia: Gobies are one of the largest fish families with over 2,000 species worldwide.

mixed.name: Mixed
mixed.description: Unpredictable movement that alternates between different patterns. Requires adaptability.
mixed.tips: Stay centered and react to changes. Don't commit too heavily to one direction.

smooth.name: Smooth
smooth.description: Gradual, predictable movements. The fish moves steadily in one direction before changing.
smooth.tips: Follow the fish smoothly. Anticipate direction changes and move gradually.

sinker.name: Sinker
sinker.description: Tends to drop toward the bottom of the bar. Will occasionally jump up.
sinker.tips: Keep your bar low and be ready for sudden upward jumps.

floater.name: Floater
floater.description: Tends to rise toward the top of the bar. Will occasionally drop down.
floater.tips: Keep your bar high and be ready for sudden drops.

dart.name: Dart
dart.description: Makes sudden, quick movements in random directions. Most unpredictable behavior.
dart.tips: Stay centered and use small, quick adjustments. Don't overreact to movements.

general: Higher fishing skill increases your fishing bar size
Cast further from shore for better fish quality and rarer catches
Eating food with fishing buffs can temporarily boost your skill
Tackle can significantly change how the minigame plays
Perfect catches (fish never leaves bar) give double XP

tackle.name: Trap Bobber
tackle.best_for: Difficult fish that move a lot

seasonal.spring: Focus on Legend if you reach Fishing 10. Rainy days unlock Catfish and Eel.
seasonal.summer: Many fish available. Target Pufferfish (sunny) and Crimsonfish legendary.
seasonal.fall: Salmon runs. Angler legendary available. Walleye needs rain + night.
seasonal.winter: Glacierfish legendary. Squid and Lingcod available. Night fishing for specialty fish.
